numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph depicts the admission rate for students who have the same test scores.
2. The admission rate varies based on legacy status.
3. The admission rate varies based on the income of an applicant's parents.
4. Legacy applicants are more likely to be admitted than non-legacy applicants.
5. For income, a general trend exists.
6. If the income of an applicant's parents is higher, then the chance of admission is higher.
7. I noticed an anomaly.
8. Some applicants are not legacy applicants.
9. For non-legacy applicants, the admission rate decreases before the 90th percentile.
10. For non-legacy applicants, the admission rate increases again around the 90th percentile.
11. I do not know why this happens.
12. Universities maybe try to accept extremely wealthy students.
13. Universities maybe try to accept poor students.
14. I am a person who wants to go to college.
15. I do not want to be impaired by something that I cannot control.
16. The income of my parents is something that I cannot control.
17. This situation is an inequality.
18. This inequality affects every student who strives to get a higher education.
19. This inequality promotes students who already have an advantage.
20. The headline is: COLLEGE ADMISSIONS ASSESS MORE THAN GRADES.
